article.description: John Papale made five 3-pointers and scored 21 points to help Boston University beat Albany 69-64 on Monday night.
article.headline: Papale scores 21, Boston University beats Albany 69-64
article.linkText: Papale scores 21, Boston University beats Albany 69-64
article.story: BOSTON -- John Papale made five 3-pointers and scored 21 points to help Boston University beat Albany 69-64 on Monday night. Evan Singletary gave Albany a 64-63 lead on a layup with 3:40 left, but the Great Danes were held scoreless the rest of the way. BU's Kyle Foreman stole the ball from Singletary and finished the fastbreak layup. Peter Hooley missed a game-tying 3-pointer with 22 seconds left and Papale hit two free throws to seal it. Nathan Dieudonne and Foreman added 15 points apiece for BU (1-1). Foreman also had seven rebounds and five assists. BU made 10 3-pointers, while Albany struggled from distance on 1-of-13 shooting. Mike Rowley and Peter Hooley each scored 15 points for Albany (0-2). Travis Charles added 14 for the Great Danes, who are the three-time defending America East champions.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
